review_blob:
Unlike many of the people who seem to delight in hating the yearly spate of pumpkin ales, porters, stouts, etc., I actually like the seasonal offering a lot. Unfortunately, this one is not one of the best I've had.
Not much of a pumpkin nose or palate, but nicely smoked, with spices.
I wouldn't pay the $9 for a bottle again, but I don't hate myself for trying it as I've done with some.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sometimes flavored ales can be way overdone; take some of the fruited ales for instance, especially those that just add flavoring rather than brewing with the fruit.
I doubt Guadalupe Brewing actually threw apple pies into the wort for this beer, but the effect is quite nice, and not overdone, IMO.
Nice nose of (you guessed it) apple pie, with a nice wheat beer finish.
I'd buy this again; good summer beer. Would actually be really good with vanilla ice cream.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Guadalupe Apple Pie Style Texas Honey Ale

review_blob:
Nice head that lasts; distinct smoky flavor separate from the aroma. Pumpkin spices as an aftertaste that lingers on the palate very pleasantly.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Excellent IPA: beautiful color, nice hopiness, sweet aftertaste. I sincerely hope that Rogness makes many more craft brewed ales for us all to try!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I have to disagree with those who would rate this beer below a 4.00 overall: this is one of the best IPAs I've ever had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Good ale; little light on the kick side at only 4.4%. Overall a lighter ale than I've come to expect from Stone.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Not bad for a Busch beer; can detect cocoa, pleasant party beer. Better than Bud or Miller...
